HAT package

Submodules

HAT.graph module

class HAT.graph.graph(a=None)[source]

Bases: object

This class represents pairwise graph structures.

clusteringCoef(vx)[source]

Computes the clustering coefficient of a single vertex.

property degree

The degree matrix of a graph.

erdosRenyi(p)[source]

Constructs a $G_{n,p}$ Erdős-Rényi random graph. … .. rubric:: References

1

  1. Erdős and A. Rényi, On Random Graphs, Publ. Math. 6, 290 (1959).

2

    1. Gilbert, Random Graphs, Ann. Math. Stat., 30, 1141 (1959).

featureDM(G2)[source]

Computes a graph distance measure defined by comparing the distance of the adjacency matrices between 2 graphs with respect to some metric.

Parameters

  • G1 – A graph object

  • G2 – A graph object

  • centrality – Specify the centrality measure metric used to compare the graphs.

Returns

A similarity measure between the two graphs.

References

1

Surana, Amit, Can Chen, and Indika Rajapakse. “Hypergraph dissimilarity measures.” arXiv preprint arXiv:2106.08206 (2021).

property laplacian

The Laplacian matrix of a graph. See equation 1 in [1].

References

1

Surana, Amit, Can Chen, and Indika Rajapakse. “Hypergraph dissimilarity measures.” arXiv preprint arXiv:2106.08206 (2021).

property normLaplacian

The normalized Laplacian matrix of a graph. See chapter 16.3.3 [1].

References

1

Spielman, Daniel. “Spectral graph theory.” Combinatorial scientific computing 18 (2012).

pairwiseDistance(vxi, vxj)[source]

Computes the pairwise distance between vertices i and j.

spectralDM(G2)[source]

Computes a graph distance measure defined by comparing the distance of the adjacency matrices between 2 graphs with respect to some metric.

Parameters

  • G1 – A graph object

  • G2 – A graph object

Returns

A similarity measure between the two graphs.

References

1

Surana, Amit, Can Chen, and Indika Rajapakse. “Hypergraph dissimilarity measures.” arXiv preprint arXiv:2106.08206 (2021).

structuralDM(G2, metric='Euclidean')[source]

Computes a graph distance measure defined by comparing the distance of the adjacency matrices between 2 graphs with respect to some metric.

Parameters

  • G1 – A graph object

  • G2 – A graph object

  • metric (Euclidean, Manhattan, Canberra, or Jaccard) – Specify the metric used to compare the graphs in.

Returns

A similarity measure between the two graphs.

References

1

Surana, Amit, Can Chen, and Indika Rajapakse. “Hypergraph dissimilarity measures.” arXiv preprint arXiv:2106.08206 (2021).

HAT.hypergraph module

HAT.multilinalg module

HAT.multilinalg.hosvd(T, M=True, uniform=False, sym=False)[source]

Higher Order Singular Value Decomposition

Parameters

  • uniform – Indicates if T is a uniform tensor

  • sym – Indicates if T is a super symmetric tensor

  • M – Indicates if the factor matrices are required as well as the core tensor

Returns

The singular values of the core diagonal tensor and the factor matrices.

HAT.multilinalg.multirelation(D, order=3, type='Drezner')[source]
HAT.multilinalg.supersymHosvd(T)[source]

Computes the singular values of a uniform, symetric tensor. See Algorithm 1 in [1].

Parameters

T – A uniform, symmetric multidimensional array

Returns

The singular values that compose the core tensor of the HOSVD on T.

References

1

  1. Chen and I. Rajapakse, Tensor Entropy for Uniform Hypergraphs, IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON NETWORK SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING (2020)

HAT.plot module

HAT.plot.incidencePlot(H, shadeRows=True, connectNodes=True, dpi=200, edgeColors=None)[source]

Plot the incidence matrix of a hypergraph. :param H: a HAT.hypergraph object :param shadeRows: shade rows (bool) :param connectNodes: connect nodes in each hyperedge (bool) :param dpi: the resolution of the image

Returns

matplotlib axes with figure drawn on to it
